intro: Senecio biebersteinii, commonly known as the Bishop's Cap, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are usually gray-green and covered in a fine layer of white hairs, which help reduce water loss. Senecio biebersteinii is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and hardy nature.
